original_conversation.content: [shaky voice] They said yes. They actually— they actually said yes. [pause] I keep reading the email over and over because I can't quite believe it's real. [relieved] All those nights staring at spreadsheets until my eyes burned, running scenario after scenario, it actually worked. [quietly] When I walked into that boardroom last week, they looked at me like I was, um, like I was crazy. [chuckle] This junior analyst telling them their restructuring plan was all wrong. [passionately] But the numbers don't lie! [pause] The Midwest division wasn't failing, it was just structured wrong. [happy] And they saw it. They finally saw what I was trying to show them. subject: The special situations analyst solution you proposed getting approved and saving two hundred jobs
